  5345. May as well put one of those furry hats on my eyelashes and call it a guard at the national gates.<br /><br />Today, I cried my face off thanks to two aggressive onions I took down in battle.
  5346. I am so in love with this mascara, I believe I found my tube for life, it would be a hard competition to beat this one!!
  5347. other brands that cost as much took several layers to achieve the same look and in the end they flaked off and irritated my eyes.
  5348. It gives a natural, long look to your lashes!

  5350. Honestly, I didn't really see a difference. :(
  5351. I really like this one as it smudges a lot less.
  5352. This mascara is so black in color that it really helps make my lashes pop.
  5353. It was old, dry and I will not buy again.
  5354. Long lasting without any irritation, which is saying a lot since I have incredibly sensitive eyes and skin.
  5355. I go from school directly to company dance rehearsals for 5 hours, and this mascara is the only one I have found that don't run throughout my long day.
  5356. It goes on effortlessly, stays on all day long, no smudging, no smearing, no flaking, not black dots under my eyes.
  5357. Was not use to using a thin bush however the mascara goes on easy, makes my lashes longer I would buy this product again.
  5358. This mascara goes on smoothly and doesn't clump, but still makes my lashes look thick and long.
  5359. If you put it on quick and thick it looks clumpy.
  5360. It doesn't give me super thick lashes, but I don't want that.
  5361. When I ordered &#34;It's So BIG Volumizing Mascara&#34; by Elizabeth Mott I was a little hesitant because it cost more than what I usually pay for mascara.
  5362. they come straight back down.
  5363. I am not thrilled about how much comes out and how it can quickly become a mess on lashes sticking together.
  5364. I have such fine, short lashes that its hard to find a mascara that doesn't make them look like 2 spiders stuck to my eyelids!
  5365. I have tried drugstore brands as well as higher end mascaras all with fairly good results and this is by far the worst mascara I have used since I can remember.
  5366. I have normal to oily skin and with other mascaras I have smudges under my eyes by lunchtime - but never with this one.
  5367. So far it's not clumping and hasn't gotten dry, which is a big plus for me.
  5368. I cross train pretty hard and after 2 hrs there were no black circles under my eyes.
  5369. I am a blonde, in my late 50's, and with this mascara and a slick of Aveda lipstick, I look decades younger and effectively boost sales of a cruelty-free cosmetic.
  5370. Bought this because of all the positive reviews but it clumped after only a few weeks.
  5371. After reading all the great reviews I was surprised at how bad this mascara turned out to be!
  5372. If you need staying power AND volume, and happen to have thin, fine lashes, the search may continue.
  5373. I have thin fine lashes.
  5374. Absolutely NO flaking or smudging throughout the entire day - WOW!
  5375. Plus I love the dark black pigment color!!!
  5376. I am in the minority because I simply was not impressed at all by this mascara, and as another person pointed out, I'm a little baffled as to how this has so many positive reviews.
  5377. I certainly don't get what the hype is all about and wish I hadn't wasted my money.
  5378. I have very dry, sensitive eyes which are irritated
  5379. It also leaves your lashes BLACK, like DARK BLACK AND glossy looking, not gray like many others.
  5380. It does add little volume to my lashes but irritates me eyes so much they burn and become red.
  5381. : they didn't appear longer or really that much bigger, just a little bolder.
  5382. , I wear mascara to work out and other physical activities, and #3, I live in a sub-tropic climate where I tend to (ahem) perspire a lot.
  5383. Not only does this stuff cling to your lashes like a spider monkey to a back, it removes easily with makeup remover (I nearly tear my lashes out with other waterproofs I've worn), there is NO clumping when you apply it, and seriously ladies...
  5384. I had really high hopes after reading the other reviews, but it falls flat on all fronts.
  5385. I found this mascara to be very average, very chunky in the application.
  5386. Very natural look without all the clumps like the other mascaras do.
  5387. My sensitive eyes that really seem allergic to all waterproof mascaras and maybe half of the other ones have never had a sensitivity to this mascara.
  5388. It does have an interesting sort of formula which seems less heavy than other mascaras I have tried.
  5389. I gave it four stars because the good outweigh the bad.

  7. All the other 5 star reviewers are right: this really is the perfect mascara.<br /><br />No smudging, no clumping, easy to apply, easy to remove (I use Almay water-based eye makeup remover), very little of it makes your lashes long and lush, so it goes a long way, and the ONLY mascara my super-sensitive eyes can wear.<br /><br />Over the counter, store-bought mascaras all make my eyes watery and irritated, and they have chemical odors as soon as I pull the wand out. That is not the case with this wonderful mascara. It is pricey, but it is well worth the money, trust me (and I'm cheap). I will buy only this mascara from now on.

  26. This mascara is pretty good in some ways. It leaves your eyelashes curled. It seems to lengthen them. It stays on really really well -- through exercise, through sleep, through the whole day - no flaking or smudging. But it's supposed to be volumizing mascara and it doesn't really do that. It does the thing I hate for mascaras to do which is to group my eyelashes together, so that it looks like I have about 40 really really thick spiky eyelashes. It comes off easily with just normal washing with the face cleanser I use, but it comes off in curly long wormy things. That's not really bad, more just interesting I guess. But I had to study those at first to make sure my actual eyelashes weren't coming off. (They weren't.) So, I'm going to keep trying to work with this and layer it with other mascaras to see if that helps, but I won't buy it again. My favorite mascara in terms of how it looks on is Revlon Grow Luscious, but it flakes off like crazy, just as a side note. So my search for the perfect mascara continues...
  27. I love this mascara. I bought a MAC mascara and loved how it looked but would always flake off and smear after a few hours. This product looks and acts like the MAC mascara but doesn't smear and flake and washes off easily.
  28. Honestly, I didn't really see a difference. :(
  29. This is the single greatest beauty find since botox. I am a resident doctor in a busy county hospital. This mascara lasted through a thirty hour call shift. That means all night, in and out of medical masks, falling asleep at my desk, 5 cups of coffee and usually one tearful moment of exhaustion wondering why I didn't pick a career that lets me sleep at night. But when my attending shows up in the morning my lashes still look great, and no one can tell how rough my night was. Then when I get home it comes off easy with a little warm water and some gentle rubbing. My only complaint with this is it leaves black specks in my sink when I wash it off but really who cares. I will be a faithful patron of this mascara for a long time.

  134. Absolutely love this product! I have been using it for a few years now. I have tried so many different types of mascara with hopes of finding one that would not bleed on my upper eye lid or under my eyes. I have modeled for many years and have had many makeup artist tell me, after I inform them off my mascara issue, &#34;ohh this mascara I have will definitely work&#34; or &#34;you haven't tried this mascara i have here! &#34; only to have the bleeding issue continue! Then I came across the It's So Big Mascara by Elizabeth Mott and I requested a sample from their website as I read so many suggest and I'm so happy I did! I was very skeptical, thinking it would be no better than all the others I've tried, but I was proven wrong. The mascara wand is a perfect size, in my opinion, to evenly cover all my lashes. I can easily put on one coat for a natural look or a few more for a bolder look without it looking fake. I do not wear much makeup anyway but I can quickly hit my lashes with this mascara and that's it & be good to go! The best part, it does not bleed under my eyes or rub off on my upper eye lid, not even during the hot Texas summers!!! It can come off some while swimming but again it doesn't have that bleeding/running effect that makes you look like you've been crying for hours, it comes off &#34;softer&#34; if you will. A friend may mention, while swimming, that i have a few. ..yes just a few, black specks under my eye, I use my finger and swipe under my eyes & that's it (for the part that comes off that is). It doesn't smear all over my pillow case if I forget to remove it before bed, yay! Nor is it difficult to remove while I am washing my face. I have taken it to photoshoots with me and suggested it to the makeup artist, they liked it so much they were asking me where they could order it! Overall, it stays when and where it needs to stay, is easy to clean off when that time comes & it does not irritate my eyes at all!!! I HIGHLY recommend thismascara and hope you all have the same experience with it as I have! :)

  164. Let me preface this review with two notes: 1. I have very fine, thin hair in general, and my eyelashes are no exception. There isn't a lot for ANY mascara to work with. 2. That said, I've had success with cheaper mascaras in getting volume-- but they smudged throughout the day. That lead me to this mascara.<br /><br />First, the good: this stuff LASTS. I'm used to looking like a post-break-up poster child by about 10am every day because nothing sticks to me. Not so with this stuff-- once it's on, it's ON. Doesn't budge until I wash it off at the end of the day. To boot, washing it off is NOT an eyelid pulling marathon of pain, either. It comes of nice and easy with my usual make-up remover.<br /><br />Now, the not-so-good: it did not give me volume. I'm used to layering up on mascara like putting on sweaters in a snow storm, but it wasn't much good here. No matter how many extra coats I tried, my lashes remained stubbornly stick-ish. I could always fall back to using a different mascara under this one, but I feel a little resentful of that when I've spent twice as much on this mascara as I have on others.<br /><br />In sum, if you've got decent lash volume and just need something that will stick with you all day THIS IS FOR YOU. If you need staying power AND volume, and happen to have thin, fine lashes, the search may continue.

  275. First off, I want to say... I was not given this product for free in exchange for a review. I feel like you almost can't trust amazon reviews anymore! My go to mascara has been &#34;Benefit They're Real Mascara&#34; and I love it but I had an amazon gift card and I was in dire need of mascara so I thought I would try this because it had great reviews. Here is my verdict: The formula is just superb! its so light that its perfect for those with UBER THIN LASHES. It allows you to layer on the mascara to form longer lashes. With Benefit They're Real, you definitely get volume, but also tons of clumping... you have to clump it on, comb out clumps and repeat x333 and it took me forever. This stuff is 3-4 layers for lengthening and 5-8 for volume. This looks way more natural and lasts way longer. I also swept this over the ends of false lashes, giving it a fuller look without the heaviness. Its also a soldier against smudging, tears and humidity. But, It does flake if you touch your eyes too much. The mascara is easily removeable without stubborn residue on lashes or mascara deposits into the skin. Overall, I would say Benefit gives more volume, but also clumps. This mascara lengthens and is more natural looking, but doesn't give as much volume. I like a lot of volume so personally it is a tie for me, but this one is a little cheaper (about $4-$5) so I might have to go with it from now on!
  276. This is my new favorite mascara, and I've tried too many to count. Many other brands go on smooth at first, but start to dry out and clump after only a few weeks of use. This brand seems to stay fresh longer without clumping or drying. It also stays on until you wash it off. It does fade a bit throughout the day, but I have yet to find a brand that doesn't. I also like that there is no odor. Some of my other favorites went on well but had a strong chemical odor. Although I will continue to try new products, &#34;It's So Big&#34; is the front runner for now!

This is the only mascara I've ever tried that both stays put without smudging and is easy to remove. At my age, I use a good amount of undereye moisturizers, and that was causing smudge even with waterproof mascaras that were a nightmare to try to clean off at night. The It's So BIG Volumizing Mascara has never smudged and it easily wiped off at night - I don't know how they came up with this formula,but it works perfectly. THIS mascara gives me the same lengthening effects, but it is so lightweight, is easy to remove at the end of the day and NO flaking or running.   570. Don't get me wrong—I was very satisfied with this mascara. It also—while not waterproof—does come through on it's claim to be smudge-resistant.<br /><br />Moreover, if you hate every mascara you've ever tried and are still on that lifelong quest for something that gets your makeup through the day, I would definitely recommend giving the It's So Big Mascara a try—it's unlikely to let you down. However, if you've already found your perfect mascara but (like so many of us) continue your hunt since you think the grass MUST be greener on the other side, you may want to re-evaluate this one. It's still a good buy and could very well be as good or even better than your current favorite, but I'd probably take the inordinate amount of glowing reviews with a grain of salt. Unless you're currently living a raccoon-eye nightmare, don't expect this to change your life.

My one complaint is that it doesn't lengthen quite as much as some of my other mascaras that I have tried but I'll make the sacrifice and keep wearing this mascara.
  724. I try a lot of mascaras. I'm looking for full lashes. I have found some good ones but they tend to flake off on me. This is a very good mascara that I will purchase again. I was also thrilled with how fast I received the product.

  825. So I went a little crazy last week and ordered 3 mascaras. I will rank them, in order, in case anyone else has a severe mascara anxiety meltdown.<br />1. Lash Factory 3D Fiber - It was at least $10 less than what I paid for the Younique fiber stuff and just as good. Love it.<br />2. Arbonne It’s a long story – Very smitten with it. I would say this is the best non 3D/Fiber mascara out there. I wore it and my friend – who is more crazy than I am and has a strange fixation with the fact that I have young looking eyes, so you know she really studies me – said “You’re lashes look super long today”. I actually consider this to be like a middle ground between regular mascara and the fiber stuff. Mascara purgatory, but in a good way. Sometimes you don’t want to be all decked out but you want that intensity or definition… Also it’s a little cheaper on Amazon, I think my friend spent about $12 more buying from someone else.<br />3. Elizabeth Mott It’s so big – last place. Don’t get me wrong it’s good, but not as rich and dramatic as the others. I would say this would be more like a base coat type of mascara, which is how I will use it. And it was the cheapest, so I guess you get what you pay for.

  838. I've been on the hunt for the perfect mascara for many years now, so when I stumbled upon Elizabeth Mott's It's So Big mascara and read all the amazing reviews I had to give it a try. I ordered a sample from the company's website and when I first tried it I was instantly IN LOVE!!! The brush was perfect, the liquid had just the right viscosity, not too runny not to thick, and it went on SO smoothly,I could apply coat after coat without any clumps! It lasted the entire day without any flaking and it didn't end up under my eyes. I also went for a run at the end of the day, and the mascara was STILL on my lashes. It has an AMAZING staying power for a mascara that's not waterproof, yet washing it off was a breeze. It comes off quickly, you don't have to rub it, and it doesn't smudge all over your eyes like regular mascara..... It just melts off your lashes. I immediately bought the full size mascara and though I still love it, my only complaint is that I think the opening of the full size tube is too wide for the brush (which is the same size as the brush that came with the sample) so it pulls out a LOT of product and I really have to scrape it otherwise my lashes get clumpy. I ended up swapping the brush to a different one and it works MUCH better. That said, I still highly recommend it, and I will purchase again.

  873. Brilliant product. Best mascara I've tried. The formula borders on revolutionary.<br /><br />It's especially good at adding length and curl. I have short, stick-straight lashes, but this mascara actually curls my lashes--no curler needed. And I cannot emphasize how clump-free it is. Zero clumps. It's the key that makes it dramatically buildable, without ever leaving your lashes looking fibrous and spidery. I've experimented with building my lashes until they look like falsies. There are probably other mascaras that give you bigger lashes faster, but I don't think there's another that will give you lashes so big and natural at the same time. It's also so lightweight that your lashes stay soft and nice to the touch.<br /><br />It also does not flake, run, clump, or come off until you want it to, and then it rubs off easily with warm water. I've worn it to the gym and run a 10k on the treadmill, sweat pouring down my face. I've worn it to bed and woken up with great lashes. It does not waver. It does not fail. The formula is really something special. It kind of reminds me of Blinc--even though it's not \\"waterproof\\" per se, it's not exactly water soluble either. It doesn't turn into wet ink when you get it wet. Rather, when I rub it off in the shower, it comes off in soft pieces, sort of like Blinc's \\"lash tubes\\" (google it). But unlike Blinc, It's So BIG has a way better formula.

It comes off very easily with just warm water - I lightly rub my eyelashes at the sink in the evening between my index finger and thumb with some warm water, since the mascara contains fibers to build volume they come off like little tubes and it is great because you don't get that Raccoon eyed - I need to wash my face again LOOK. The fibers just literally rinse away! This mascara is the best I have ever used (I have tried nearly every designer brand at Sephora)!
  920. this is such a good mascara, doesn't flake, stays on until you take it off, and the best part, its cruelty free!!
  921. I was so impressed by this mascara after receiving a sample that I bought the full size. It has a unique formula, the texture kinda looks thick and gluey, like eyelash primers, except very black. Or if you've ever used Milani infinite eye liquid eyeliner, the texture is kind of like that product, a bit thinner though.<br />I like that this product really holds up during the day with no smudging or flaking. It's takes at least a day for the product to begin to break down, and it will flake, not smear or run when it does. It does remove fairly easily with eyemakeup remover, considering its staying power. And it will come off in flaky clumps or mascara crumbs on the cotton pad when removed.<br />When I curl my lashes and use this mascara, they slowly go back to being mostly straight again while the product is drying. :(<br />But the wand is the reason I rated this mascara 4 instead of 5 stars. The brush is wide in the ends and narrow in the middle. Really awkward and given the struggle I have with this design, I think it's more fancy than practical. I wish the brush were a just a practical cone shape, wide at one end and tapers narrow at the other end. It would be a lot easier for me to use the narrow end where I need it and wide end where I need it. The narrow part being in the middle is mostly useless to me, esp when I try to rock the brush at the root of my lashes, the narrow part won't reach the roots well, and the thick ends end up getting mascara all over my eyelids while I'm trying to get that narrow part to rock at the root. Anyway, because of this awkward design, I find myself using the wide end the of brush at the end of the wand only, and it's more time consuming to apply mascara than it would be if the brush were just... a little less fancy. Luckily, this product doesn't screw up my eyemakeup if I get it on my lids. once dry the mistakes just kind of fall off.<br />Despite the few short-comings, I still really like this mascara. It's doesn't feel heavy, it lasts all day, is nice and black, and just looks pretty. Not too natural, but not too voluminous and heavy either.
  922. I love this mascara. It's really good. My eyelash looks really long. At the firts time I felt a little disappointed, I thought that was a waste of money. The brush is just perfect and the formula goes on so silky smooth and really does last all day (& into the next morning - NO RACCOON EYES!) comes off very easily when washing your face or in the shower but be warned: Don't try to wipe it off with makeup wipes because you'll inevitably take some eyelashes with it. However, this product was more like Blinc Mascaras that use &#34;tube-technology&#34; to form tiny water-resistant tubes around lashes for amplification & hold, rather than painting them. Once applied, Blinc claims that the tubes don't run, smudge, clump, or flake. BUT they also don't add volume & I got the same lackluster performance with this It's So Big Volumizing Mascara.<br /><br />This product is probably great for people that already have thick, long lashes, & need a mascara that will last all day. However, if you're expecting something that will transform unnoticeable lashes to noticeable, you're better off using the aforementioned Revlon Grow Luscious brand -- I know I still am, until I find something even better.

  1258. I've been using this mascara for about two months now, and I really want to like it, but unfortunately I don't think I'll be using it again.<br /><br />Yes, it will give you dramatic lashes. Yes, it stays on ridiculously well (too well in my opinion.) It stays on all day and doesn't give me raccoon eyes, which is great. The problem is when I try to wash it off.. I don't want to have to use a special makeup remover to take off my mascara, and I don't want to use something with harsh chemicals. I find I have to tug a bit and wipe pretty hard to get the stuff off. It's also very drying, making my lashes break off.<br /><br />My natural lashes are noticeably shorter and thinner since using this mascara.. I haven't had this problem with any other mascara. I can see why people like this mascara, but I personally don't want my natural lashes to be damaged.
  1259. Oh my gosh! The reviews were correct. This mascara is wonderful, awesome, the best ever! I used Lancome Virtuose Black Carat mascara for years. It wasn't perfect, but it was the best I could find. They stopped making it a year ago and since then, I've accumulated a drawer full of mascaras that did not deliver as promised. I'm very sensitive to those fibers that flake off and fall in my eye and blur my vision. I have eyes that water - a lot, so I need mascara that doesn't smear or drip when wet. I ride a motorcycle and often my eyes tear something awful from the wind. Sunglasses can only protect so far. I can't stand mascaras that clump and leave piles of mascara blobs on my lashes and then everything is a thick, sticky mess. I have been beside myself trying to find the perfect mascara. This is it!!! I just received it one hour ago. I hadn't put on makeup yet today so I went right in the bathroom and applied my shadow and liner and then - this mascara NO CLUMPING! It goes on so easily. Just a smooth and easy application and it lifts and separates every single eyelash individually. No one would know that my lashes are short and point down because this mascara pulls the lashes up into a sweeping butterfly look without any clumps of mascara at all. It is flawless looking. It's the most perfect mascara I have ever tried. THANK YOU SO MUCH!!! I will be buying this from now on. Don't every stop making it and don't change it one bit.

I'm one of those consumers that doesn't care what the brand name is as long as it works well, is reliable, and serves my purpose. My everyday make-up kit has a mix of high-end and drug store items that I'm dedicated to. I was a bit unsure of buying this due to the price (I have been disappointed in several higher price tag mascara's before) but it overall it was worth it. This mascara has become my new favorite! To be clear, this mascara isn't really like my old Full n' Soft. That mascara would flake off eventually, but I would forgive it since it looked beautiful/natural and didn't irritate my eyes. I'm a born redhead with sensitive skin so I like to (and have to) keep to a neutral/natural palette so I don't look ridiculous. I do notice that when removing my mascara it does not dissolve off, instead it comes off in little clumps, like it was truly coating my lashes, which explains why it doesn't flake off while wearing it. This mascara, the It's So Big - is true to its name. It adds a subtle drama with fullness and length to my lashes that I haven't had since I was a teenager. It looks professional, but not overdone. The great thing is that it lasts all day without failing on me or requiring a touch up. It's a keeper.

  1395. Update: to the creator of this mascara - Please consider making the same formula with a different brush!! Preferably one with longer bristles. Still love the formula, but the brush IS hard to use. I have many requirements when I look for a mascara, as it is the most important cosmetic for me personally. They are: no smudging/flaking, contact friendly, dark black color, able to create moderate to high drama, and preferably comes off with soap and water. Here is my mascara background: not sure why, but most eye products smear and smudge on me. For that reason, I always wore tubing mascara. More recently, I decided I was not happy with the look of tubing mascara, since it is not very buildable, and I wanted more drama. So I went on a mascara buying spree. I won't name all of them, but none of them were &#34;the one&#34;. I guess amazon noticed I had been searching for lots of mascara, and It's So Big popped up in my recommendations. I was intrigued by all the good reviews, so I ordered a sample. I was really impressed when I tried it. Yes, the formula looks a little weird when the wand comes out of the tube, like black lava or something. But it goes on easy, the brush is not too big or small, the color is dark black, it is super buildable, and the best part, IT DOES NOT SMUDGE OR FLAKE!!!! It also comes off easily for me with a few rounds of soap and water (In flakes, not black smears, yay!). The only drawback for me at that point was it did take quite a few coats to get the drama I was looking for. Then, just for kicks, I tried it with my Shiseido primer. All I can say is WOW. It takes two coats over the primer, and my lashes are exactly everything I've ever searched for. To the creator of this mascara: thank you!!

  1463. I've begun using this mascara, exclusively, because it makes my lashes come alive and there is no irritation. It stays on, no smudging or clumping off...and it comes off quite easily with makeup remover. I'm done with searching for the &#34;perfect&#34; mascara. I've found mine.
  1464. I've worn contact lenses for 15 years. I've worn makeup for around the same amount of time, and I'm sure my fellow contact wearing sisters can commiserate with me about the frustration and pain they have gone through when mascara gets into their contacts, either from crying, in the shower (or crying in the shower), rain, sweat, whatever it may be that causes the mascara to run and get in your eye. It's not comfortable for non-contact wearers either, but its especially crappy when you have the stinging and burning and you are trying to see your way to the bathroom through a mascara-induced fog.<br /><br />And then another issue I've always had with mascara has been that it always seems to leave a nasty black racoon stain under my eyes, and the effort it takes to get it off makes me wonder if I'm not causing some serious aging damage to my delicate under-eye area every time I remove my mascara stains. It's just a hot mess. But we wear it because we want beautiful, long, thick lashes.<br /><br />I decided to get a free trial of this stuff and now have an order on the way because I have finally found my solution. This stuff is awesome. It really is sweat-proof and it comes off easily in the shower, but it clumps and rolls so that it isn't staining my skin or running down my face all awkwardly. I can now cry in movies and walk out of the theater without shame. It doesn't run into my contacts, so I can still see after I wash my face with my contacts still in.<br /><br />Is it going to give you magically longer lashes? No. I've got long lashes already, so it's not my primary goal here, but let's face facts. No mascara is going to make your lashes longer. That's what eyelash extensions and falsies are for. And if you want to try a cool little trick... do a coat of mascara, then dust your eyelashes with baby powder and coat it a second time. They will look longer and be thicker too. I read it on Pinterest.. so it has to be true, right?<br /><br />Bottom Line, this mascara does what it is supposed to do. It darkens, thickens and shows off your gorgeous lashes. It also doesn't make a mess, but it's not water proof so it's not ripping your lashes out by the root when you scrub to get it off, it comes off easy, it just comes off different than most mascaras. It's wonderful. Buy it. Or go to the website and get a free sample and try it., thickens and shows off your gorgeous lashes. It also doesn't make a mess, but it's not water proof so it's not ripping your lashes out by the root when you scrub to get it off, it comes off easy, it just comes off different than most mascaras. It's wonderful. Buy it. Or go to the website and get a free sample and try it.

  1529. I usually am a loyal user of Blinc Mascara, which is a tube mascara. I like my mascara to thicken and lengthen, and most of all, I do NOT want it to smudge after a long day. UPDATE 7/27/16- I fell off the It's So BIG Mascara bandwagon last year because I felt as if the formula somehow changed, and my lashes were not as voluminous or as dramatic as they once had been when I used this product. In fact,the mascara left my lashes feeling flimsy, and the formula felt dry and crumbly. I tried several other mascaras over the next few months and felt disappointment every time. Nothing had compared to the beautiful, thick lashes that I once had as a result of It's So BIG Mascara. I felt so lost. On a whim, I decided to contact the company and to explain my disappointment of my most recent tubes of their mascara. I didn't expect anything, I just wanted to inquire if the Elizabeth Mott company had somehow changed their formula or if any other customers had observed a difference with this product. I have never received such awesome customer service because they promptly replaced my last two failed tubes of mascara at no charge, and apologized for my recent bad experiences! It was above and beyond anything that I had expected and I am so grateful to their customer service team. All companies should follow their lead. Unfortunately, the mascara was still disappointing. No explanation by the company in that regard. I hate to remove a star for this but the quality is definitely not what it used to be. The company itself receives 4 stars alone for impeccable customer service!

(Previous review): I had BIG hopes for volume from this mascara, but in my opinion, it does not live up to it's name. I will say it doesn't seem to clump, and it may give you a little more length, but definitely not big volume (even after several coats). It's difficult to make it more than 2 coats anyway without my lashes ending up stuck together (maybe you create volume by making one big eyelash)? ;) The brush does not help to separate them, it usually contributes to the problem. For volume and lash separation with a good brush, I'm sticking with my Max Factor False Lash Effect mascara. If you want less volume but little clumps, then this may be the mascara for you. I used to get L'Oreal Voluminous waterproof and it ran under my eyes by the end of the day. I tried many others which also ran. This mascara does not run even after a long day of work! I was amazed. It does have an interesting sort of formula which seems less heavy than other mascaras I have tried. It's like the difference between whole milk and skim milk - that's the best way I can describe it so it may not seem heavy enough or thick enough for some people. It does darken and thicken your lashes but there is something different about the way it is formulated. For me, it works great and stays on all day. It comes off easily with most soaps although I have had to struggle occasionally to get it off with just soap depending on the soap. Not sure if it stays on in the pool or ocean... Overall very very pleased...and no bunnies had to suffer!!!!

  1673. I have tried mascara from department stores, sephora, all the top brands and this is my favorite. I wish it didn't' clump so much the thicker I applied but I pinch the tips when it gets too clumpy and just reapply starting at the base to tip to give the tips a more whispy appearance. Usually a little soap and water work well to wash off the mascara, however I have had some lashes fall (very few). I will start using an eye make-up remover to see if it makes a difference. Overall I like the product.
  1675. I gave this a 4 out of 5 stars because, it is a great mascara and works well. After 2-3 uses it does flake and make little specks when you wash it off. Only when you wash it off though. It comes off easily and does not smear while wearing. I have a more oily skin, especially around the t-zone and eyes, and this does not smear for me. It defines, separates and lengthens very well. If you apply 4-5 coats, it also volumizes well too.Just don't let it dry between coats, keep applying until you get the result you're seeking.<br /><br />Over all this is a great mascara, far better than departments store brands. I wish it came in a waterproof option though. To my knowledge, it does not.<br /><br />The only reason I did not give this a 5 star is because, it claims to(if you use an eyelash curler) to help your eyelashes hold their curl, it does for a short while, but they fall after so long. Not a big deal really, but I wish it did. I still notice a difference in the fullness and length of my lashes however, so no complaints there!!<br /><br />Other than that it is a great product and I would recommend it to others!<br /><br />Hope this helps!
  1676. This is one of the best mascaras I've ever tried and continue to go back to it even though I like to try new mascaras. This one is perfect for everyday and reminds me of the 2000 calorie mascara by Maxfactor (which isn't sold in the US anymore). Doesn't smudge or flake and only clumps with too many coats. This mascara works best on lashes that have been curled. Unless you have naturally long lashes with a curl, you need a lash curler to achieve the best results. I have Asian lashes so I would know :)

  1734. This is a pretty great mascara, although at first I was nervous about choosing a brand I had never heard of. (Clearly you are too, or you wouldn't be reading the reviews.) Don't worry - you can trust them, because I was actually very impressed with this product.<br /><br />First of all you get this funky brush with a tiny flail at the end. (A ball covered in spikes, for those aren't nerdy enough to know about medieval weaponry.) The bristles are nice and close together so they coat your lashes well, and the 'flail' is great for accessing those hard to reach areas around the corners of your eyes.<br /><br />The mascara is a nice inky consistency that ensures you wont end up with hideous chunks and clumps. I wouldn't say this was a magnificent &#34;volumizing&#34; mascara, but holy cow did it lengthen them. If they want to slip an innuendo into the product name, they should just call it Lash Extenze. I have sad, short, thin lashes (to match my hair!) and after I've applied my mascara they look just lovely.<br /><br />One tip: definitely curl your lashes first. I know most of you are already, but for those who find that curling contraption terrifying...muster your courage and please reconsider because it makes a HUGE difference. How big? It's the difference between &#34;bra&#34; and &#34;no-bra&#34;, only for your lashes. Try it.

  1745. I am very picky about mascara. For the last 30 years I've used L'Oreal Lash Out and more recently L'Oreal Bare Naturale mascara, and nothing else. I had heard about all the new lash extending mascaras so went on to Amazon to search for some. This one was the highest rated, though I'd never heard of it. Thought I'd give it a try. Have to say, it is my new favorite and I've bought 5 more to stock up. I have three requirements for mascara:<br /> 1) I have sensitive eyes that water very easily, so it can't irritate my eyes or run easliy.<br /> 2) I'm lazy and don't take my make up off at night, so it needs to come off in the shower easily.<br /> 3) I like a brush that I can use horizontally as well as vertically to get all the inside lashes as well as the bottom lashes.<br />This mascara lives up to all three.<br /> 1) My L'Oreal mascara would run when my eyes watered, but not this. If anything, it will just come off one or two of the inside lashes. Like other reviewers have said, the mascara coats the lash so when it comes off it does so as a little tube, which means it doesn't smear all over your face.<br /> 2) It comes off easily in the shower once it gets saturated. I used to have dark circles under my eyes after my shower, but no longer.<br /> 3) The brush is easily used both horizontally and vertically. I'm not crazy about the hour glass shape - I'd probably rather it not curve in the middle, but it still works great.<br /><br />Can't say enough good about this mascara. I did find it seems to dry out a little rather quickly, but I just add a couple of drops of water (did that with my prior mascaras as well) and it rehydrates and applies easily.

  1780. I received a free sample of this mascara about 2 weeks ago, and have used it 8 times. If you are happy with this price point, but not happy with the product, I would recommend Benefit's They're Real - now THAT is worth every penny!<br /><br />The pros: no clumps, no flakes, wears well and removes easily.<br />The cons: NO volume to speak of - this is a really thin formula that delivers, at best, a lengthened natural look. Not unlike what you get with a $4 tube of classic Great Lash. I also found that I had to re-curl my lashes after applying - which I never need to do with other mascaras - but this formula, as it dries, straightened my lashes.<br /><br />If you are on the fence, do order a sample - you can get one through Mott's page. Mine took less than a week to arrive.

They look so long, dark, and it does not clump my lashes as i have tried high end brands from sephora and i dont like how they clump my lashes up together its not a good look. This one leaves my lashes really beautiful and i can also get my bottom lashes looking real nice. I dont notice any smell, and the staying power is good.

This product doesn't state hypoallergenic but I've had no problems with it. It's amazing how it lengthens my lashes but there isn't any product breaking off throughout the day. My typical day consists of going to work, the gym, home and it stays on strong with no issues.   1881. Don't buy it if you love your lashes! I lost more than five hairs after taking it from first use.
  1882. I usually use L'Oreal Voluminous mascara. I have used it for years. I was hoping that this mascara would make my lashes look thicker. It didn't. It was a very nice mascara. But nothing special. Too expensive for what you get. It's just average.
  1883. My wife just absolutely loves this. I have to order more today!
  1884. I'm in the beauty industry & have tried hundreds of mascaras, not only on myself but also on others. I was immediately impressed with Elizabeth Mott's &#34;It's So Big&#34; mascara; it did what it promised to do without clumping, flaking or wearing off. This is my new go-to mascara & will be recommending it to friends & clients.
  1885. I know this is going to be a very unpopular review, but I have to be honest:<br /><br />I have a really embarrassing hair pulling disorder called trichotillomania. It is a horrible, horrible disorder for a girl to have....especially in high school and college! I pulled my eyebrows, eyelashes, and some hair on my scalp from ages 8 or 9 up until the present, where I'm now 28. As a result, I now have NO EYEBROWS...they stopped growing at all after so many pulling spells in high school. I don't mean I have sparse eyebrows like most girls who say they have none do....I mean I have NONE. I actually just got permanent cosmetics last year for eyebrows and eyeliner tattoos. In addition to no eyebrows, I had no eyelashes....I mean my eyelids were BALD up until now. While they were bald, I hid it by drowning my eyes in a sea of dark, dark liners and eye shadows. However, I finally started to try resisting my pulling urges once I got my eyebrow and eyeliner tattoos. The eyebrow hair has yet to even THINK of trying to come back, but my eyelashes have! My eyelashes, for the first time in 20 years, are back! Granted, they are not luxurious, beautiful lashes I've always dreamed of having, but compared to having none, and not being able to wear mascara for two decades, it is welcomed!. So, they are back but they are very, very, very thin and spaced far apart. But, since they have returned, I have literally tried every mascara I could get my hands on! You ladies who can rock just one coat of mascara and look normal, I envy you! Anyway, I searched for my 15th or 16th bottle in 6 months....trying every single one I could before my urges to pull possibly resurface. I figured this mascara would do wonders according to the rave reviews....but, it didn't. If any of you who are reading this know this disorder like I do, you know that even the slightest clump, bump, strayed hair, etc. only eat at your pulling desire even more. That is what this mascara does. It is mediocre at best. Not only does it do a poor job separating lashes, but it also leaves a hard, flaky bit at the tips of your lashes. Not only does that look rather ugly, it also makes urges even worse. I still gave this item 3 stars, not because it causes urges....that is NOT the make up's fault....I am fully aware of that....but because it ranks up there with pretty much any mascara you can get at the drug store much cheaper. The best mascara I have used so far is the CoverGirl Volumizing Lash in the orange tube you buy at any ole drug store. Like I said, this won't be a popular review, but in case someone else out there is searching for the same reason I was, I hope this is helpful.does it do a poor job separating lashes, but it also leaves a hard, flaky bit at the tips of your lashes. Not only does that look rather ugly, it also makes urges even worse. I still gave this item 3 stars, not because it causes urges....that is NOT the make up's fault....I am fully aware of that....but because it ranks up there with pretty much any mascara you can get at the drug store much cheaper. The best mascara I have used so far is the CoverGirl Volumizing Lash in the orange tube you buy at any ole drug store. Like I said, this won't be a popular review, but in case someone else out there is searching for the same reason I was, I hope this is helpful.
  1886. This mascara is so soft! I was surprised by that. And it really doesn't flake off. It is a little easier to take off with a mascara remover but if you don't have any your cleanser of choice and water does the trick. This mascara creates a natural look for daytime and two coats at night a bolder, but still natural look. A nice feature - the hourglass brush gets into the corners without poking yourself with a pointed end. This is a really nice mascara.
  1887. I have sensitive eyes and have tried many mascaras, at every price point. This one is proving to be a winner for me. It goes on smooth and does not clump or flake off. I typically don't reapply during the day, which isn't a problem with this mascara. This is the first Amazon review I've written but felt compelled. Great product at a reasonable price.

  1889. This is absolutely THE BEST mascara I have ever, ever worn in my life. I am 48 years old. I seriously have tried them all. I have dark lashes and I really wanted a waterproof.   1895. Pros:<br />-- Stays on, doesn't flake or crumble, for a good 24 hrs. Never had a mascara that didn't migrate to the lines under my eyes after 5 hours. LOVE THAT.<br />-- I mean seriously stays on. Even on a humid, greasy-faced July day. I've gone to bed wearing it and woken up looking just as good.<br />-- Good look -- I only do one coat and get nice definition and volume (though I do employ an eyelash curler before applying).<br />-- Great price. For how it performs, I'd pay twice that.<br /><br />Cons:<br />-- Seems a little hard to remove. It says you can do it with a regular face wash, but I don't think that's true -- seems to hang out on my eyelashes and face for a few days after. I remove it with make-up remover now but it still lingers a bit.<br />-- If you get an errant eyelash with mascara on it poking you in the eyeball, may God help you. It's itchy and very painful. Never happened to me before with other mascaras.<br />-- Given how well it stays put, I sort of worry it might be damaging my lashes.<br /><br />Overall:<br />-- Have recommended it to my mom and bestie.   1972. Love this mascara. Makes my lashes look BIG and NO FLAKES!!! LOVE LOVE LOVE
  1973. As a professional salsa dancer, it's been impossible for me to find mascara that doesn't sweat off, smear, or flake. I've tried Revlon, Maybelline, Este Lauder, Bare Minerals, and Benefit. No luck. All were runners. Then I found this stuff. Holy wow. I put about 1.5 coats on, and my lashes are about half an inch long, and full without any clumpiness. And to top it off, not only does it make my eyes pop, but it stays throughout an 8 hour session of hot and sweaty salsa. Not a single flake to be found. And it just washes right off. I'll never use anything else ever again.
  1974. Great mascara. No clumping and separates lashes. Provides length and volume. I have super fine lashes and has tried many mascaras. I highly recommend this product.
  1975. BUY IT! It's better than Maybelline in the pink tube (costs more, too).
  1976. Awesome mascara! The best I have tried. My lashes are long and thick. It is also easy to remove and does not burn my eyes. Got 2 more for my sisters!
  1977. love it ...never knew my eyelashes could get so long and thick!!! easy to wash off and stays put too!!<br /><br />can't go wrong really!!!
  1978. After reading the other reviews, I was excited to try this mascara. It's okay, but not my favorite. I like that the mascara is easy to remove, but it clumps, and I'm not crazy about the application brush. I'm sticking to Benefit's &#34;They're Real!&#34;. It's a little more expensive, and difficult to remove, but creates prettier lashes.
  1979. I bought this mascara based on the reviews and I am maybe slightly disappointed. It's not the mascara itself at all. I wore it yesterday (after using my new Eyelash Curler - INSTA-CURLER by FUCHSIA Line, which is the bomb-diggity) and the mascara itself is great. I didn't even wash it off before bed (I know! I know.) and it didn't really run or flake off.<br /><br />I wish it had a different brush. I don't like the bristles or its shape. Granted, I have long eyelashes and a lot of them so I didn't feel like the brush &#34;combed through&#34; my eyelashes as I would have liked them to. A brush that is more shaped like Cover Girl - Lash Exact would be better for me.
  1980. Having been diagnosed this past summer with severe iron deficiency,I lost a good bit of my eyelashes.I just recently completed iron infusions,and noticed my eyelashes stopped falling out.I have been on a quest to find a good lengthening mascara,that does not flake,or pull out even MORE of my eyelashes.I found the perfect mascara in Elizabeth Mott's Volumizing Mascara.Even though I do not have an abundance of lashes,the ones I do have are thick looking and long when using this mascara.You sometimes do not appreciate what you have,until it is gone.Thanks to this amazing mascara,I have my femininity back!
  1981. stays on you without smearing! water resistant! pulls eyelashes up and the best ever! im so happy with it!
  1982. Funny - received a free sample in a People Magazine VIP reward. I love this mascara.
  1983. Absolutely NO raccoon eye with this mascara. None. Zip. Zero. It makes my skinny non-existent lashes and really makes them pop!
  1984. I love this mascara. It beautifully separates & lengthens your lashes, and also thickens to your desire, depending on how many coats you apply. It also washes off more easily than any other mascara I've ever used. A terrific product.
  1985. Not the worst mascara I've used but certainly not a great as I'd expected base don the reviews. Doesn't separate my lashes and gets a little clumpy when applying a second coat.Eh, I'll use it but I'm disappointed.
  1986. I have short eye lashes and this mascara gives my lashes some length. I love it!
  1987. Bought this for my wife since her make up bag was lost.....I made the right choice and she's extremely happy with it, price was great and delivery was fast as well.
  1988. The reviews are legit - this stuff is the best. It goes on smooth, doesn't clump. Your lashes really do get noticeably bigger with repeated applications, although for me, one application is plenty for daily use. But the most amazing thing to me is the staying power. At night I wash my face with an awesome cleanser that leaves not a trace of makeup. Not a trace, except for my perfectly intact mascara. It takes a gentle rub with an eye makeup remover to take it off. Even though it's not billed as a waterproof mascara, I've totally been swimming in it with nary a smudge. If they discontinue this makeup, I'll curl up in a ball and cry.
  1989. I have spent more than 30 years and no telling how much money seeking my HG mascara and have finally found it! This excellent mascara makes my eyelashes thick, long and they stay curled. Even better, no flaking or raccoon eyes. It absolutely rocks my world! Thank you very much!
  1990. Best mascara I've ever used! Love it!!
  1991. Boy did I need this stuff! I love it, now I actually look like I have eyelashes!
  1992. I tried this mascara after reading about it in a magazine. It's ok..not a &#34;10&#34; but decent. I really haven't found anything that beats Lancome. It's expensive, but it's good stuff. I probably won't buy this again.
  1993. Works...does stay on for length of time and doesn't smear during the day...doesn't work well w/lash primer as it tends to clump on lash...over-all, satisfied.
  1994. Best mascara I have ever used hands down!!! I have been looking for a great product like this for a long time. I will certainly continue to use this mascara for a long time!!!
  1995. super soft lashes. buildable too and doesn't clump!! i am in love. i will be ordering this. finally found an HG mascara. &#60;3 !
  1996. Love this stuff. It looks great, doesn't clump, and doesn't flake off under my eye. Sometimes after a particularly long day I notice some wear or dark circles but that could also be from eyeliner, and I haven't found makeup yet that doesn't do that at least a little if you're outside in the elements all day. For the most part though it stays on nicely, and I'm pretty picky about mascara.
  1997. It isn't as volumizing as I hoped, but it really does define, and it's smudge proof. In terms of volume nothing beats Dior Show, but that smudges so easily I always have raccoon eyes!
  1998. when I first got this mascara, it was in a box from people magazine, I absolutely loved the product and continue to buy it on Amazon. At some point the formula must've change because the product is not as good as it was, I still like it but I don't love it like I did.
  1999. Great mascara. It takes a few applications, but it does create really long, soft and thick lashes. And it seems to have real staying power.
  2000. No clumping! Yay! Goes on easily and leaves lashes looking long and sleek.
  2001. It was old, dry and I will not buy again.
  2002. It is the best!!!!!!!!! Worth to try!
  2003. Best mascara I have ever purchased!
  2004. Not impressed for the price. Gave me spidery eyes. I've used cover girl mascara that was better
  2005. I've been using it for about two weeks and really like it! The way the brush is shaped really reaches more of my lashes as I'm applying the mascara. So far it's not clumping and hasn't gotten dry, which is a big plus for me.
  2006. works well but I don't think it lives up to the price.
  2007. Don't waste your money .. I was so disappointed when I used this mascara .. The reviews tricked me .. Your better off with a $7 mascara from a drugstore
  2008. I love this mascara. I've been searching for a plumping mascara that goes on easily for years. I saw this one recommended and tried it. I'm on my second tube now. It makes my unimpressive lashes really stand out. I can apply multiple coats without any clumping. It comes off easily too. This will definitely be my go-to mascara for a long time to come.
  2009. This is a nice mascara certainly worth trying if you're at all interested. I didn't want to pay what I view as a 'hefty' price tag for a tube of mascara so I ordered the sample size which is a decent size. I just had to pay S&H which was something like $2.75 for me. I've been using it about a week and a half and there's plenty to last a few more weeks (I apply it once, daily).<br /><br />So let me start by explaining my type of lashes and what I look for in a mascara. I have long, straight lashes that are of standard thickness (if I can say such a thing. Basically, they're not thick but they're not thin... just normal). And since my lashes are already long, when looking for a mascara I focus on volume and a nice consistency that is not too wet. I find wet mascaras tend to make more of a mess when applying and I can't stand having to clean up around my eyes after applying; so, I suppose I like a thick, sturdy formula-- non-runny. Also, so far I don't believe any mascara has the true ability to curl lashes--at least mine, so that value is never a focus. Eyelash curler is the only sure way I'll get any curl. SO, basically what I look for in a mascara is its capacity to add volume to my lashes and not make a mess! And this mascara has proven a winner!<br /><br />To illustrate it's ultimate test, I applied a regular amount one early morning as I was preparing to spend the day snowboarding. Now granted I was wearing goggles, there were plenty of times I had the goggles lifted off my face and was subject to the wintery conditions of the slopes. About half-way through the day or so I stopped to have lunch and while in the restroom inspecting my makeup, I noticed the mascara had not smeared, smudged, or flaked. Any definition they may have had from my curler was done seeing as how facial steam in my goggles straightened them but the volume on the lashes themselves was as they were when first applied. By the end of the day I was extremely exhausted, realized my car was stuckin some snow, realized further that tow trucks were not willing to truck out to my location to help me, cried several tears in overwhelming exhaustion and frustration, and when I went to clean up my face in the restroom, was at least satisfied that my mascara did not run down my face or smear, but simply sat in small clumps under my eyes similar to how a tubing mascara comes off, and I very easily wiped it away with a tissue, still not smearing or smudging. I very much like a mascara that can hold up to watery eyes and a few tears and this did it. And considering it came off in a tasteful manner when I was really crying and rubbing my eyes, this passed the test. (and btw, I did manage to get a tow truck to come out. But they had to come from over an hour away and it cost $300!!! Crazy. Ugh.).<br /><br />So all in all, thumbs up for this mascara. It adds a tasteful amount of volume, layer-able for more if you're headed for a night out, stays put, and doesn't make a mess!<br /><br />The reason I gave it 4 stars is because I think $20 is a little high and like I said, the volume is tasteful and buildable, but I wouldn't say it added some crazy amount of volume-----BUT, considering all I went through with it, I'll probably pay it for the full tube when my sample runs out ;)
  2010. For someone with ultra blonde eye lashes this is a great mascara! Makes my eyelashes long and full. I am really enjoying it so far!
  2011. I adore this mascara. It lasts all day without under eye smudges. It is mostly lengthening, but if you put on a few coats it becomes much more voluminous, too. I also recommend doing some serious lash-curling prior to putting the coats on. I'm going to stick with this mascara for awhile now.
  2012. For the last few weeks, I've tested the resolve of this mascara by flying down the ski slopes at 35-45 miles per hour. Although the goggles I wear are only the first defense against the high ninja winds, and my eyes do nothing but cry tears of pain (wusses), leaving the mascara as the final line of defense from causing children to run screaming in terror. There were no crying babies - no forest animals ran for the hills. This mascara was stoic and never faltered. May as well put one of those furry hats on my eyelashes and call it a guard at the national gates.<br /><br />Today, I cried my face off thanks to two aggressive onions I took down in battle. The mascara did nothing - no consoling words, hugs or encouragement. I will continue to put myself in harms way knowing this mascara will defend my honor... or at least my self worth.
  2013. I am 62 and I finally found a mascara that stays on and DOES NOT SMUDGE! This is really a great product.
  2014. It is very easy to apply and remove! Thanks for a wonderful product!
  2015. Best mascara I've used in some time. Stays on all day, no flaking or smudging. Goes on smooth and has lasted about 1.5 months before it started to dry out in the tube a bit. My new favorite!
  2016. The product is OK, it is not the best. it dries out very quickly and it is difficult to reapply. I would not buy it again
  2017. AMAZING. & I thought the Too Faced Better Than Sex mascara from Sephora was the best. I was wrong! This has to be one of the most perfect mascara ever. It easily adds volume and length to your curls, although not to an extreme extent. I think the best thing about this for me is that you can VERY easily remove it with makeup. I used to use the cheap Maybelline mascaras which kept me content for a while, but whenever I try to remove it with makeup wipes, it was NOT an easy job. I felt like I had to scrub harshly against my eyes and the delicate skin around it. But with this mascara, I only had to wipe with minor pressure and BAM it's gone. The only downside is that it can indeed cluster your eyelashes together, but I still love it!
  2018. Best mascara ever. I am a convert for life.
  2019. I first recieved this product as a sample. After that I was hooked! It is the best mascara I have used and I love my mascaras! I have purchased anywhere from $5-$35 mascara and this beats any of the top brands out there!
  2020. I received this product initially through a premium gift package with a People Magazine subscription. As someone who has short blond eyelashes that grow downward, this product is a miracle. After use, a friend asked me if I was wearing false eyelashes. I love this mascara.
  2021. This product is everything it is advertised to be! Gives your lashes great length and definition, lasts all day long with NO SMUDGES! I apply it when getting ready for work each morning at 6am, it looks great all day until I remove it with a facial cleaning cloth at 9pm. Really good mascara is hard to find, but this product is the perfect mascara!
  2022. Great mascara for the price. Easily applied and no re-application needed. I love this product!!!
  2023. I love this mascara! Everything about its performance is superb. No odor, perfect texture, separates and lengthens lashes beautifully without clumping and stays separated all day.
